title: Huave (1996) New Testament
description: Huave (also spelled Wabe) is a language isolate spoken by the indigenous Huave people on the Pacific coast of the Mexican state of Oaxaca. The language is spoken in four villages on the Isthmus of Tehuantepec, in the southeast of the state, by around 20,000 people.

language.name: San Mateo Del Mar Huave
language.area: Southeast coast, Oaxaca, San Mateo del Mar.
